page.title: 17Headmasters Interview
page.content: John Brown is has been headmaster of Woldgate School, Pocklington for the past 12 years. {Q. What do you think are the {advantages of a pupil attending {Woldgate School rather than {Pocklington School ?} A.I think there is a social advantage, I can best illustrate this by the case of the Thornton Family, whose father was Vicar at Everingham for a long time until fairly recently. All four children came to us, although Anglican Ministers' children usually go into private education. Reverend Thornton's view was that Woldgate was a miniature world and he wanted his children to know that the world is populated by all sorts of people with all sorts of ideas, some rich, some poor, and he wanted his children to grow up realising this.
